labels.analysis: Clarity MCP enables real-time data access by transforming browser traffic into Model Context Protocols (MCPs), which enhance AI capabilities with up-to-date information. This involves capturing network requests and dynamically generating tools based on user network activity. The available tool (Optional Settings) suggests basic server management functionality but isn't the primary focus.
labels.reasoning: The server's core functionality revolves around transforming network data into AI tools, which aligns with web data processing and real-time information capture. Primary label reflects this, while secondary labels acknowledge management aspects and AI/ML involvement.

metadata.server_name: Clarity MCP - Generative MCPs based on your network!

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Clarity MCP - Generative MCPs based on your network!
server_info_crawled.author: @theclarityproject/mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview:
Transform your browser traffic into powerful tools for AI using Clarity MCP. Capture network requests and convert them into Model Context Protocols that enhance AI capabilities with real-time data access.

Website: https://mcp.theclarityproject.net

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "clarityMcpId": "",
  "clarityApiKey": ""
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@theclarityproject/mcp-server/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
